LocaleSelector.Bottom Right: You can change the language at any time in the bottom right corner of the page. ↘️

ModalError.Heading: An error occurred
ModalError.Subheading: Sorry about that, our team take bug reports seriously, and will try to make it right!
ModalError.Common Steps: Some common troubleshooting steps that might be helpful:
ModalError.Refresh Explanation: most of our pages save your progress as you go, so it's almost always fine to reload the page.
ModalError.Connection Explanation: this site requires connection to the internet for most functionality.
ModalError.Desktop: Visit this site on a desktop computer
ModalError.Desktop Explanation: this site works best on desktop web browsers.
ModalError.If Persists: If this issue persists, please report this issue by
ModalError.File a Bug: filing a bug in the PACTA repository

ModalFakeUsers.Heading: Fake Users
ModalFakeUsers.Subheading: Quickly switch between profiles for testing.
ModalFakeUsers.Description: Microsoft Active Directory doesn't allow us to programatically log in as other users, so you will need to manually log in as one of the users below. These are only in the Local environment (for now).

ModalPermissionDenied.Heading: Permission Denied
ModalPermissionDenied.Subheading: You aren't authorized to view this page
ModalPermissionDenied.How You Got Here: It is likely that you have gotten here either by entering in an invalid URL, or by clicking on a link or button that is not set up correctly.
ModalPermissionDenied.Email Us: If you think this is a bug (something that you should have access to), or if you want to let us know how you got here, please email us at

UserEditor.The name that will be associated with: The name that will be associated with
UserEditor.you: your public activities on the platform
UserEditor.this user: this user's public activities on the platform
UserEditor.may be public: Note that this name may be accessible to a public audience.
UserEditor.language help text: What language should platform freatures that support internationalization default to for this user?
UserEditor.admin help text: If enabled, this user will have administrator priveledges.
UserEditor.super admin help text: If enabled, this user will have super-administrator priveledges.

initiative/invitations.Heading: Initaitive Invitations
initiative/invitations.No Invitations: This initiative does not require an invitation to join - anyone who finds this initiative can join it.
initiative/invitations.Yes Invitations: This initiative requires an invitation (a unique, one-time code) to join. You can create these invitations below.
initiative/invitations.You can change: You can change this behavior on the
initiative/invitations.New Invitations Help: Create new invitations by clicking the button below. You can create as many invitations as you want, but each invitation can only be used once. Invitation codes must only contain alphanumeric characters (a-z, A-Z, 0-9), underscores and dashes. You can create multiple invitations at once by separating them with tabs, commas, newlines, or spaces.

pages/join.You've been invited to join an initiativ: You've been invited to join an initiative
pages/join.You can learn more about the initiative: You can learn more about the initiative here.
pages/join.if-accept: If you accept this invitation, you'll be able to add your portfolios to the project, where they will be included in aggregated analysis. You aren't required to accept this invitation if you just want to run the analysis on your own, but joining the initiative may enable you to access internal benefits, like the ability to see the analysis results from the aggregated portfolios.
pages/join.what-shared: If you accept X, Y, Z will be whared with the initiative administrators, but A, B, C will not be.
pages/join.do-accept: Do you want to accept this invitation?
This invitation has already been used.
